title: Online Course: General Biology II by Mary Power at Berkeley
description:
Course Description

General introduction to plant development, form, and function; population genetics, ecology, and evolution.



Lecture 1 - Prokaryotes - Cyanobacteria, Archaea - Eukaryotes - Algae, Fungi, Bryophytes 1

Lecture 2 - Prokaryotes - Cyanobacteria, Archaea - Eukaryotes - Algae, Fungi, Bryophytes 2

Lecture 3 - Pteridophytes and Gymnosperms I

Lecture 4 - Pteridophytes & Gymnosperms II

Lecture 5 - Angiosperms 1a

Lecture 6 - Angiosperms 1b

Lecture 7 - Angiosperms 2

Lecture 8 - Angiosperms 3a

Lecture 9 - Angiosperms 3b

Lecture 10 - Angiosperms 4

Lecture 11 - Plant Form and Fluid Transport Plant Nutrition, Hormones and Defenses 1

Lecture 12 - Plant Form and Fluid Transport Plant Nutrition, Hormones, and Defenses 2

Lecture 13 - Plant Form and Fluid Transport Plant Nutrition, Hormones, and Defenses 3

Lecture 14 - Plant Form and Fluid Transport Plant Nutrition, Hormones, and Defenses 4

Lecture 15 - The Science of Ecology and its Methods

Lecture 16 - Climate, Microclimate and Biomes

Lecture 17 - Resources and Conditions in Aquatic and Terrestrial Habitats

Lecture 18 - Autecology, Behavior, and Life History Traits

Lecture 19 - Population Biology

Lecture 20 - Species Interactions: Competition, Predation and Parasitism

Lecture 21 - Species Interactions: Herbivory, Detritivory and Mutualism

Lecture 22 - Food Webs, Food Chains and Species Interaction Strength

Lecture 23 - Disturbance and Succession

Lecture 24 - Ecosystem Ecology: Primary and Secondary Production

Lecture 25 - Ecosystem Ecology: Elemental Cycling

Lecture 26 - Spatial Patterns of Species Richness, Island Biogeography, and the Design of Biodiversity Reserves

Lecture 27 - Species Interactions with Ecosystems

Lecture 28 - Global Change

Lecture 29 - General Biology II Exam Review

Lecture 30 - The Big Picture and the Big Questions - Biodiversity

Lecture 31 - History of Evolution

Lecture 32 - Darwin and Later

Lecture 33 - Cladistics

Lecture 34 - Molecular Genetics and Molecular Evolution

Lecture 35 - Tempo and Mode in Macroevolution

Lecture 36 - Early Earth, Continental Drift, Early Life

Lecture 37 - Fossil record: Precambrian and Paleozoic

Lecture 38 - Fossil record: Mesozoic and Cenozoic

Lecture 39 - Mendelian Genetics, Hardy Weinberg

Lecture 40 - Hardy Weinberg Departures: Genetic Variation & Drift

Lecture 41 - Selection

Lecture 42 - Speciation

Lecture 43 - Sociobiology and evolution in popular culture, other fields

Lecture 44 - Evolution Review Session
